description: Variant or figurative use of conch. Attested since the nineteenth century.

entries.meaning: The shelf- or bracket-shaped fruiting body of a bracket fungus (also called a shelf fungus), i.e. a mushroom growing off a tree trunk.
(slang) A nose, especially a large one.

verbs.description: conk (third-person singular simple present conks, present participle conking, simple past and past participle conked)

entries.meaning: (slang) To hit, especially on the head.

description: From congolene, the brand name of a hair-straightening product.

entries.meaning: (US, dated) A hairstyle involving the chemical straightening and styling of kinky hair.

verbs.description: conk (third-person singular simple present conks, present participle conking, simple past and past participle conked)

entries.meaning: (US, dated) To chemically straighten tightly curled hair.
examples: The barbecue cook, wearing a dirty white apron, his conked hair reddish and metallic in the pale sun, and a cigarette between his lips, stood in the doorway, watching them.

description: Unknown. Attested since the early twentieth century.

verbs.description: conk (third-person singular simple present conks, present participle conking, simple past and past participle conked)

entries.meaning: (colloquial, often with out) To fail or show signs of failing, cease operating, break down.
(colloquial, often with out) To become unconscious.
